meanings.definition: To beat or hit someone or something repeatedly.
meanings.sent1: The bully would drubber the smaller kids on the playground every day.
meanings.sent2: The blacksmith would drubber the hot metal to shape it into a horseshoe.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to drubber the dough to make the perfect pizza crust.
meanings.sent4: The waves drubbered against the shore, eroding the sand over time.
meanings.sent5: The drummer's hands would drubber the drumsticks during the energetic performance.

meanings.definition: A person who beats or hits someone or something repeatedly.
meanings.sent1: The drubber in the movie was portrayed as a villain who enjoyed causing pain.
meanings.sent2: The schoolyard drubber was finally caught and sent to detention.
meanings.sent3: The little brother jokingly called his older sibling a drubber for playfully hitting him.
meanings.sent4: The boxer was known as a drubber in the ring for his powerful punches.
meanings.sent5: The drubber's actions were finally stopped by the intervention of the school principal.
